intro: Odontites anselmei, commonly known as the Alpine toothed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes where conditions are harsh. Odontites anselmei is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows and on slopes in the Alps and other mountain ranges.
